Name: Jikkuri Millet: Masterpiece Box Vol. 2 “Winter Masterpiece”
Description: Expansion that includes 16 pieces of art with the theme of winter, special large scoring rose, and 6 new cards. Requires the base game to play.

Name: Crazy Bull
Description:
HAVE YOU GOT WHAT IT TAKES? This game requires good skills and a strategy in order to win.. simply load the bull up with you accessories, wind it up and watch as he goes crazy trying to get the stuff off his back! Tipping up, down and around the bull will make sure he's victorious.. unless you think you can beat him!

The player that collects the most items is the winner of the game.

Name: Jikkuri Millet: Masterpiece Box Vol 1
Description:
Expansion that includes 20 pieces of art, special large scoring rose, and 6 new cards. 
Requires the base game to play.

Name: Solo Camp Pocket
Description:
Solo Camp Pocket is a small card game where you can enjoy a day and a half of solo camping. There are lots of activities such as using your favorite gear, cooking meals, bonfires and kayaking. Of course there is not enough time to do everything.

The goal of the game is to have the most fun (points) as you can while camping. You only have so much time to camp so you need to make good use of your time. All the while weather can change, accidents can occur, and things can waste away your time.

The game is played by dealing a 3 card hand. Activities require different amounts of time, food, and gear; all of which you must pay for from your hand. For more expensive activities, you can obtain more resources by discarding cards or carrying over cards to the next turn (where you are dealt 3 more cards). You do this until the cards run out, ending the round. 2 more rounds are played and a cumulative score is counted. Try to beat your high score!

Name: Witchstone: Full Moon
Description:
It's full moon in the magical world of Witchstone, and as everyone knows, witches and wizards develop very special powers during a full moon. Their abilities become more powerful, and the potion in their cauldrons even more effective.

The Witchstone: Full Moon expansion includes two expansion modules that can be used individually or together, one of which features new cauldron tiles for better chain reactions; 3D miniatures; and new special cards that among other things let you activate one of two special abilities each turn.

Name: ヘクサ・ルインス 〜クロコダイルとドレイクの島〜 (Hexa Ruins: The Island of Crocodiles and Drakes -)
5 Sekund: Dzieci kontra Dorośli
Description: A totally new game from  the famous “5 second rule” series. This time there are questions from children and adults worlds. Parents can play against their kids and check how much they know about their world. Play in teams in order to earn points faster and more effectively.

Name: Madori-ism
Description:
Madori-ism is a card game in which cards are stacked and connected to create a floor plan. Place a lot of features you want and erase unnecessary features to aim for the ideal floor plan.

There are two rules included “Design Together” (for 2 to 5 people), where everyone collaborates to make one floor plan, and "Design Apart" (for 1 to 5 people), where each person makes their own floor plan. At the start of the game in both rules, you are given an entryway card that shows you a main objective and a side objective (only used in “Design Apart”) which are your main scoring criteria. These objectives are hidden from the rest of the players.

Design Together: One entryway is placed in the center and you take turns choosing from 3 floor plan cards to add on to the group floor plan. Your goal is to have as many of your main objective fixtures as possible.

Design Apart: Each player creates their own personal floor plan by taking turns choosing a card, with main objective fixtures being worth 1 VP. The side objectives, windows, and variety of fixtures are used to round out the scoring.

Name: 80's Rewind
Description:
Did you love the 80's? Think you know more than your radical significant other?

Compete in this custom made game for 2 to find out!

Full of laughs and surprises along the way!

Great to surprise your partner with, great gifts for anniversaries, birthdays, showers, holidays, or just because a hard working couple deserves some fun!

—description from the publisher

Name: CryptoSpaceGame
Description:
CRYPTOSPACEGAME lets you control an intrepid team of crypto currency miners who want to reach the world of their dreams within a year of in-game time. Can you make those dreams come true? Follow the crypto currency exchange rates, devise a clever strategy for money transfer, and multiply your riches. Win the top spot in the race to a life of luxury!

CRYPTOSPACEGAME is a peaceful game, and you will not have to attack your partners. However, you will have to obtain more crypto currency than others and get the most expensive dreams before anyone else does. Think hard, and with a little luck, you may win!

CRYPTOSPACEGAME is a game about the world of cryptocurrency, but you need no background knowledge or preparation to play it.

—description from the designer

Name: マッドネスアワー (Madness Hour)
Description:
North America, the 1920s. There is an old mansion surrounded by disturbing rumours: “The owner, a wealthy man, was devoted to ancient and blasphemous cult.”, “A decade ago, the inhabitants suddenly vanished.”, “All who entered the mansion disappeared, and the few who returned took their own lives soon after.”… The many strange phenomena that occur here hold a dark fascination attracting experts in mysticism and magic. Then, one day, the mansion is visited by a new group of people: A team of investigators from Miskatonic University. How they will end up only depends on the mysterious girl who will hold their fate in her hands…

Madness Hour is an asymmetrical cooperative game of exploration, based on the Cthulhu Mythos by the works of H. P. Lovecraft. One of the players takes the role of the mysterious girl, while the others play investigators, searching for ancient artefacts and trying to escape from a dangerous mansion. You won’t know whether the girl you will encounter in the mansion is human or something more terrifying. The girl’s intentions will depend on her identity, and she will manipulate and change the course of the investigators and the objects they hold. As they investigate, they will have to try and figure out what she is and what she is not.

The mysterious relics that the investigators find in the mansion will drive them into madness and turn them into something else. The investigation within the dark mansion is a mixture of madness and suspicion, leading to unexpected consequences. Will you be able to unravel the true identity of the mysterious girl who controls your destiny and escape from the mansion – while still being human…?

Name: A.D.E.L.E.: Alien Module
Description:
– “Emma, there’s been a breach in the starboard aft hatch. Something has entered the ship.”
– “Can you see what it is?”
– “I cannot, sorry. Whatever it is, it is draining the energy in this sector and expanding quickly. Emma, I think the ship is in danger…”

An alien lifeform has broken into the ship and intends to turn it into its lair. Of course, the crew members have no place in the alien’s plans, except perhaps as food… Only one thing can save them: creating a powerful virus that kills the creature, along with all its creations. The chances are slim and the creature get stronger and stronger with time. But they have one thing in their favor: this time, ADELE is on their side.

This Kickstarter-exclusive expansion presents a whole new scenario to use along with ADELE base game. A new set of pieces helps track the progress of the alien player while a new set of objects help the crew members face this new threat.
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: Sherlock Holmes Le Grand Quiz
Description:
A Board game and Quiz game all in one.  Each team of players/individuals choosing a playing piece, and rolls a dice to determine direction to move on the board.  Then a question is answered from 2 choices depending on what space you land on.
The questions are either about Sherlock Holmes or Arthur Conan Doyle.  
Game continues until one team or player collects all clue 6 cards i.e. weapon, footprint, pipe, magnifying glass, hourglass to win.

Name: Arsene Lupin contre Sherlock Holmes
Description:
You have been recruited by Arsène Lupin to participate with your friends in three major burglaries: find the treasure of the abbeys, take possession of the fortune of the kings of France and steal the blue diamond from the crown! But beware! Because, among the burglars, a surprise guest has managed to infiltrate: Sherlock Holmes, master of disguise, has integrated the band around the nose and beard of the great Arsène Lupin.

In addition to solving the enigmas which stand on the path of your burglaries, you will also have to identify Holmes, and his friend Watson, before he sabotages your plan. Will you manage to thwart the artifices and pierce the disguises of each other to identify who, among you, embodies Sherlock Holmes, or Watson or even the champion of dissimulation, the great Arsène Lupin in person?

Read the murder mystery, collect the clues, use decoder with cards to determine the crime, and if Arsene got away with it or Sherlock caught him.
Player or team wins when crime is revealed. If neither team guesses correctly play continues until all is revealed and one team claims victory.

—user summary

Name: The Code Agency Sonderermittlung Krimispiel Fall 2: Das Verschwinden des Gary Sander
Description:
At first glance, Kitzheim looks like a dreamy, inconspicuous place, whose small alleys wind through the tranquil old town. The idyll would be perfect if the small town weren't for the headquarters of the pharmaceutical giant Sander Chemicals, whose boss suddenly mysteriously disappears. The group is looking for answers.

In this thrilling crime thriller, investigate the background of a missing man and explore a small town where no one is entirely innocent.

Name: North Pole to Manhattan: The Elf Game
Description:
Roll and move Buddy the Elf from the North Pole to Manhattan.  Make sure to spread Christmas cheer and don’t eat the yellow snow!

This game has 2-4 players play as Buddy the elf racing to find their dad in Manhattan.  Straight roll and move game with events on the board that may move you forward or backwards (many backwards are -20 spaces).  First player to the North Pole wins.

—user summary

Name: Spuds 'N Goblins
Description:
A fast-paced, goblin-themed potato-gathering card game. Players play from three decks: Goblins, potatoes, and events. Players draw a goblin and a potato card on their turns, and may play add a goblin card to the field. Use your goblin's powers during your (or your opponent's!) turn to snag potato cards or do battle with enemy goblins. The player who gathers the most potatoes before winter hits wins! The game ends when all potatoes are gone. Will you thrive or starve?

—description from the back of the box (edited)

Name: アニマルコレクティング (Animal Collecting)
Description:
ã‚¢ãƒ‹ãƒžãƒ«ã‚³ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒ†ã‚£ãƒ³ã‚° (Animal Collecting) is a card game from Japan. The deck allows two games to be played: Hide & Seek, and Rebellion.

The players are zoo keepers and must sort the zoo out. For the game Hide & Seek, they swap cards in the style of Old Maid and try to complete sets of animals. Or they can guess the missing animal, a card drawn face-down to the table at the start of the game. However, there is also a black cat card, which a player may pass as an alternate to the requested card.

In the game Rebellion, one player is unhappy with the zoo's policies and is disrupting the zoo by hidden different animals in different places. In a one vs many game, the other three players must deduce where the animals are hidden.
user summary

Name: Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game – Borg Sphere Booster Set #2
Description:
Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game – Borg Sphere Starter.
Contains:
2xd12 Weapon Beam dice (front/starboard & front port)
8xd12 Weapon Beam dice (2 each front/starboard, front/port, aft/starboard, & aft/port)

Each booster set contains 10 new dice to expand your ship and rulebook with rules for multiplayer battles and explaining new dice effects.

Name: バナナはおやつに入りますか？(Do Bananas Count As A Snack?)
Description:
ãƒãƒŠãƒŠã¯ãŠã‚„ã¤ã«å…¥ã‚Šã¾ã™ã‹ï¼Ÿ (Banana wa o yatsu ni hairimasu ka?) is a card game from Japan, in which players must face a philosophical dilemma that has tormented humanity since the dawn of time. Do bananas count as a snack food?

In this game, the players are elemnetary school children, buying snacks to take on their school trip. They have some money and a variety of snacks choices in the shop. As well the usual chocolate bars, sweets and corn snacks, there are bananas. They must use their money wisely, and buy good value snacks, and not have too much change left over.

If a player buys some bananas, will they count as positive or negative points at the end of the game? It depends on the other children. If several children buy bananas, they count as 2 pts. But in not enough buy bananas, they count as -1 pt. Players must balance their need to spend, against the risk of elementary school childrens' opinions on bananas as snack food.
user summary

Name: ひつじのあくま (Hitsuji no Akuma)
Description:
ã²ã¤ã˜ã®ã‚ãã¾ (Hitsuji no Akuma) is a card game from Japan. The title translates as Devil Sheep, meaning Baphomet. The game box also says "How many Baphomet Do You Need?".

In the game, players are supplying various Baphomet to meet the needs of their customers. each player gets a secret character, a customer who wants a certain number of Baphomet. 
They need to provide the correct amount of Baphomet demanded to get the best score. Too many or too few, they score less or zero.

With only 5 hand cards, players must trade Baphomet without disclosing the total they really need.

On a turn, a player either places a card as part of their supply, or plays a card using the effects on the card. When placing a card, it can go face up, showing some Baphomet, or face down to be revealed at the game end.

When a card is played for its affect, this might apply to the player or to another, and moves Baphomet cards around.

There are several special action cards too, which reverse fortunes, but players could lose all their Baphomet.

When the deck is exhausted, the game ends and players turn up their cards and calculate a final score.

The publisher says that the game is more chaotic with 5 players, and more thoughtful with 2 players.

The game is listed as for age 12+, but reviewers say it is easy to play, and should really be age 8+.
user summary

Name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Earthfang Relic Die
Description: This all-new melee weapon was forged after the mighty axe "Earthfang' from Esfah lore. With SAIs like Bash, Counter, Fly, Sneak Attack, and Smite, this relic comes with great power, but must be wielded with caution...

Name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Dragonslayer Die
Description:
The Dragonslayer is a 4-health unit that is a melee machine. They are also part of the Eldarim species. A Dragonslayer can kill any color of dragon if it rolls its SFR Logo during a dragon attack. Dragonslayers can cast any color of magic (not just the colors at the current terrain). Dragonslayers can carry magical items (including medallions) of any color.

These are the champions of the Eldarim species. See the Acolytes of the Eldarim kicker for more information.

Name: Caricatoon
Description: Choose wisely the celebrity whose name you will make guess among your cards according to the challenge imposed. Attention! You only have 45 seconds to succeed! Meet the biggest stars of the world and of our country. Actors, comedians, politicians, athletes and even mystery personalities... Mime, draw, question and imitate! Laughter and fun are guaranteed.

Name: Magpie
Description:
Magpie continues the trend of Roll and Write Revolution doing out of the box ideas. In Magpie, players play as a magpie who is collecting items (Sticks, Eggs, Worms, Seeds, and Shinies). Each of the players has a hidden bonus card that will enable all players to score points for certain collections. The players will also have a plus or minus value for the Shinies, which are totaled to provide a score.

Further, the magpie players are also fighting for control of the 6 areas. They may instead of destroying the hex space to gain a resource, write in their own player symbol. The player(s) who have the most symbols in each area will score points.

Magpie forces up to four players to really gather in tight as they will all be playing off of the same sheet. Wild interactions will occur and you may wonder if your friends are bird-brains or actually clever.

Also includes a solo player variant where the player is against Martha Magpie and her love for Shinies!

Magpie plays 1-4 players in 30-60 min; Language independent components!

-description from designer

Name: アニマリーナ (Animarina)
Description:
ã‚¢ãƒ‹ãƒžãƒªãƒ¼ãƒŠ (Animarina) is a tile placement game from Japan.

Players are explorers in a wild land in Africa, looking for a lost family member. They encounter various animals who offer to help, in return for being the most favoured animal in the land.

Players draw cards in their and place them across spaces on the game board, linking up with arrows on the card edges. The player's goal is to create the largest area in their own colour. By using the animals special abilities, they can gain and secure more land.

Some animals are stronger in certain habitats, such as the gorilla in the forest. Some animals gain strength from being linked in a herd.

A player can place their animal over another if their animal has a higher number. So a #4 dog can cover a #3 dog, and extend the territory.

When the game ends, the player covering the most spaces is the winner.
user summary

Name: Dirty Laundry: Sabotage Shedding Game
Description:
Dirty Laundry is a sabotage shedding game. Outsmart your opponents by washing your Dirty Laundry first. Pay close attention to your opponents as they might play dirty and ruin your laundry. Play strategically by concealing items, such as throwing a red sock into a load of white garments. Play dirty and break washing machines so no one can win. A game built on sabotage and fabricated on messing with your opponents. Stain in your seats, Dirty Laundry is here to ruin your relationships, you have been worn!

The objective is to wash all your dirty laundry first. Fill up the washing machine with the correct cleaning fluids and press wash. Simple!

Not so fast!

This is where Dirty Laundry gets dirty, no one knows what items you have loaded into the washing machine! Players take turns to strategically place concealed items, action cards and garments into communal washing machines. Pay close attention to your opponents as they might be out there to ruin your laundry.

—description from the publisher

Name: Trekking the World: Trivia
Description:
Trekking the World Trivia is a family trivia game that lets players experience countries all around the world in a fun and interesting way. You don’t have to be good at trivia in order to play and love this game. Players will make their best guesses at the question to earn points. Anyone can play and win. Plus setup is easy—just open the box and start playing within minutes.

It doesn’t matter if you’re looking for a trivia game, games for teens, or family games, this one is perfect for your next family game night. The box is small (8x8), which makes it easy to take on the road or in the car.

Name: Let It Snow
Description:
A tiddly-wink based drafting/set collecting game!  Accumulate Holly, Ice, Silver and Gold and even Coal!  Take some fire, but too much could burn down your tree.  Draft carefully and while you're at it, stick your neighbor with something they didn't want.  It is Christmas after all.

—user summary

Let it Snow is a brand new, instant classic set collection game. Draft to improve your score, hurt your opponent's score or ideally both!  Draw, draft and score your way to victory in this celebration of winter, snow and all things cold!  And since you have no place to go, let it snow!

—description from the publisher

Name: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – New in VCK2E
Description:
Add-on available during the Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Darksworn Kickstarter campaign that included all the new cards found in the 2nd edition of Valeria: Card Kingdoms for first edition owners.

Includes:
5 Herald Starter Cards
6 Event Cards
5 Reference Cards
2 Card Dividers (Starter Herald and Monster Events_

Name: Mit År10: Quizzen om 10'erne
Description:
A quiz game with a stack of cards each with six questions about the 2010's.

At the beginning of the game, the players decide how many points to play to.

On a player's turn, he rolls the die and the player to his left asks him the corresponding question. If he answers correctly, he gets the card as a point. If his answer is wrong, the other players may hit the bell to answer the question and get the card and the point if correct.

The game ends when a player has the agreed number of points.

Name: Mini expansion set for Sprawlopolis, Circle the Wagons, Stew and Tussie Mussie
Description:
This set of 35 cards contains 9 different mini expansions to the first four games in our Master Print Mini series. These cards bring even more variation to Sprawlopolis and Stew and add a solo mode to Circle the Wagons and Tussie Mussie. The cards do not come in a box but in a zip-lock bag, for easy addition to your Master Print Mini games. The following expansions are included in this set:

Sprawlopolis: Beaches (4 cards)
Sprawlopolis: Construction Zones (4 cards)
Sprawlopolis: Interstate (4 cards)
Sprawlopolis: Points of Interest (1 card)
Sprawlopolis: Wrecktar (1 card)
Circle the Wagons: Lone Cowboy (6 cards)
Circle the Wagons: Lone Cowboy Rides Again (3 cards)
Stew: Fungus Among Us (6 cards)
Tussie Mussie: Flower Shoppe (6 cards)

Name: Boj o Velku Moravu
Description:
Boj o Velku Moravu ("The Battle for Great Moravia") is an original Slovak strategy game that will take you back to a time when there was a relentless fight between the armies of the Eastern Franks, Western Slavs and old Hungarians in our region.

Each of the players will be one of the nations and strive to occupy as much territory as possible on the playing field with the help of their military party. By occupying settlements in battles, players gain points that they can use to develop their army and settle free territory. Each nation has its own characteristics, so on the road to victory, everyone must use a slightly different strategy. The winner is the player who has the largest territory at the end of the game, but the victory can be sided with the occupation of a strategic place or the size of the army.

Name: Greater or Lesser Aquarium (大なり小なり水族館)
Description:
Build an Aquarium together while trying to satisfy the demands of the fishes

Players work together to build a 5x5 Aquarium grid while trying to ensure that the mathematical equations hold true on all connecting sides of the tile
Each animal tile states a number along with the < or > symbol on each side
Players take turns placing a tile from their hand trying to successfully build the 25 tile aquarium

Name: 18NewEngland 2: The Railroads of the Northern States
Description:
18NewEngland 2 is an alternate map for 18NewEngland. It was designed primarily as a 2-3 player game, but also accommodates 4 players. The play time should be about 2/3 as long as the base 18NewEngland game.

This expansion reuses the components from 18NewEngland except the board. Some trains and tiles are removed to fit the smaller map.

—description from the designer

Name: Space Cat
Description:
Space Cat is a game of dexterity. You have to complete your part of Galaxy take cards from the space. To get a card you have to launch your rocket onto the right planet or right star. You can also attack your opponents and take a card from them.
The first who completes their board is the winner.

—user summary

Name: PicNic
Description:
It’s time for a picnic! Rabbits and foxes work together to find as many fruit and vegetables as they can, as quickly as they can. So that they don’t get lost, they decide to tie themselves together with a string. Which team will gather the most carrots, watermelons, apples and pineapples?

Your meeples, a fox and a rabbit, are tied-together and you have to move them to take fruit optimizing their movement. Each turn, a wheel will be spun and you have to move according your meeples that are tied together so have limited movements.

When three pineapples have been taken, the player with most fruit will be the winner.

Name: Around The World
Description:
Each players has to send six postcards from different cities to win. To move to each city, they can walk the streets or use boats, airplanes or trains.
It is very important to optimize the movement to win.

—user summary

Name: Floralia
Description: Each gardener will need a good memory and a strategy for flipping the pyramids in the right direction to find weather that is indicated on the current page of the books to help a flower to grow. First who has a complete beautiful flower will be the winner.

Name: Ride the Rails: The Netherlands
Description:
Ride the Rails: The Netherlands is an expansion for Ride the Rails that can also be used with the Winsome original Rail USA. The game is for 3-5 players, takes less an hour, with one page of expansion rules.
 The game covers the entire nation on two 11x17 inch color maps. Among other elements, the player attaining the Maatschappij tot Exploitatie van Staatsspoorwegen receives a hefty bonus. The terrain in The Netherlands has no Mountains, but plenty of Impassible waterways.

Name: Call to Adventure: Epic Origins – Heed the Call Promo Card
Description:
Promo Card for Call to Adventure: Epic Origins originally available as an Early Backer reward. Later available in pack E of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign and then in pack Archer from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

You may journey for free. If you gain a trait or attempted a challenge revealed this turn, gain 1 experience.

Name: Zookeepers: Promo Cards
Description:
Expand your "Zookeepers" game with these 10 new special species to save:

Card #1 - American flamingo
Card #2 - One-horned rhinoceros
Card #3 - Manchurian crane
Card #4 - Green aracari
Card #5 - Black-and-white ruffed lemur
Card #6 - Hyacinth macaw
Card #7 - Slender-tailed meerkat
Card #8 - Common Green Iguana
Card #9 - Common Bottlenose Dolphin
Card #10 - Frilled Lizard

Name: Describing Movies Badly
Description:
Are you naturally bad at describing movies? Don’t know actors names? No problem. Can’t remember the plot. No sweat!

Can you describe a movie badly enough where your team can guess the movie but bad enough where the other team has no clue what you’re talking about?

This is a funny game where you challenge your friends movie nerdiness by reading a bad description of a movie and they have to guess the movie from your bad description.

--For solo play--
Cover the name of the movie.
Guess the movie by the bad description only.

—description from the designer

Name: Anno Domini 1666: Dragoon with Blunderbuss and Musketeer with Halberd
Description:
A set of special models that can be swapped into the factions in the core Anno Domini 1666 set. A Dragoon with a blunderbuss for the Defenders of the Crown and a King's Musketeer with a halberd for the Musketeers. These characters are considered 'unique' and replace one of the standard Musketeers or Dragoons when deploying a force.

This addition to Anno Domini 1666 was released as a limited promotion during the 2021 holiday season via the Wargamer Games Studio online shops. Both metal and plastic versions of the models were produced.

Contents:
2 miniatures (Dragoon with blunderbuss and King's Musketeer with halberd)
2 character cards
1 rule card
4 item cards

Name: Nook: Le Racoon et les Ouassous
Description:
Nook and his friends enjoy fishing for crayfish under the Caribbean sun. Only Rainbo, the Lorikeet, disapproves of these frenzied fishing parties and will try to stop them.

Each player has cards representing a team of raccoon dogs with different strenghs, some lobsters  and a parrot. Every turn, you select one card, hidden face. By bluffing the others and a little bit of luck, the player will have to select the correct one, to catch the lobsters of the other players (only the biggest raccoon of the trick wins) without being disturb by a parrot.

Name: Oui!: Le grand jeu de l'amour et du hasard
Description:
(Name meaning : "Yes ! The game and chance", inspired by a book of Marivaux)

This game is a quiz of 1340 questions about love. Movies, History, Literature, Songs... everything will be explored, and by any means : drawing, quiz, mimes, memory games...

The board consists of a heartshape track with spaces in three different colors, corresponding to different difficulties. Players roll a dice and move along the track. When a player stops on a color, he gets a question of the appropriate difficulty. A correct answer allows the player to roll again.

Once a player reach the middle of the board, he win the game.

—user summary

Name: The Defeat of Medusa
Description:
The Defeat of Medusa (ãƒ¡ãƒ‰ã‚¥ãƒ¼ã‚µã®æ•—åŒ—) is a deduction game from Japan.

One player is the Medusa, who turns people to stone by her gaze. Another player is the Hero, sent to defeat the medusa. The remaining players are statues, previous victims of the Medusa, who know her weakness. The statues must convey this weakness to the Hero, before Medusa identifies it first.

The Statues know what the Medusa's vulnerability is, and they choose to freeze in poses in order to suggest what it is. The hero must try and work out what this is and declare it before the Medusa does. If so, the Hero and Statues win. But if the Medusa has also worked it out, the Hero and Statues lose.

Medusa's weakness could be a variety of things, and a deck of cards suggests the types of things it could be. For example, it might be 'a certain dish', 'a creature', 'a character', 'a certain occupation', 'a certain color'.

Name: Busy Busy Bake Shop
Description:
The Busy Busy Bake Shop is the most popular donut shop in town! They have all kinds of flavors you can mix and match. But lately there’s been a problem: a donut-loving mouse is sneaking off with some of the donuts! Can you stop the hungry mouse from swiping all the tasty donuts? Match up the different flavors of donuts to boost color and pattern matching skills, and practice counting as you calculate how many donuts you saved and how many treats the mouse snuck off with! Players work together using simple strategy and fine motor skills: if you can place 4 donuts in a row before the mouse runs off with 3 donuts, you win the game!

Develops fine-motor skills, cooperation, counting and color and pattern matching Ideal for home or classroom use.

—description from the publisher

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Scorpion Combo Pack
Description:
This Combo Pack contains two XL Dark Stone Scorpion Miniatures and all of the rules, die-cut counters, and cards for BOTH the Dark Stone Scorpions and the nightmarish Bone Scorpions for use in the Blasted Wastes and Forest of the Dead OtherWorlds!

Though the massively mutated Dark Stone Scorpions are renowned for their thick shells, potent poison, and razor edged claws that can snap a man in two with a single powerful pinch, the nightmarish Bone Scorpions that roam the alien desert dunes of the Blasted Wastes and the shadowy groves within the Forest of the Dead are perhaps more terrifying. Equal in size and ferocity with their earthly counterparts, the Bone Scorpions are more agile and quick to enrage, lashing out with the lightning fast retaliatory strikes of its stinging tail at any that draw too near.

Name: Spire's End: Marin Ally Card
Description: Marin is the 8th Playable Ally for Spire's End!

Name: 2 Simple Rules: Co-Op dice game
Description:
A co-op dice game for 2 to 5 players of simple rules and dice rerolling. Everyone gets four dice, then a goal is revealed and then 2 simple rules. Everyone tries to add to the goal before everyone has to reroll.

—description from the designer

Name: Uesugi Civil War: Battle of Sanemakihara
Description:
Uesugi Civil War is a wargame based on the Battle of Sanemakihara that took place between Yamanouchi Uesugi clan and ÅŒgigayatsu Uesugi clan on February 5, 1488 in the current city of Isehara.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uesugi_clan

Yamanouchi Uesugi clan invaded with a large army of 1,000 cavalry, but ÅŒgigayatsu Uesugi clan, who had only 200 cavalry, defeated Yamanouchi Uesugi clan by taking advantage of the terrain.
This game recreates this battle with a total of 44 playing pieces and an easy-to-understand map connecting key points with roads.

Name: Don't Mix It!
Description:
The Recyclables Sorting Game.

It's sorting time at the recycling center, and each player has their own sorting board to separate the glass, metal, paper, and plastic.

In Don't Mix it!, players place tiles depicting various different recyclable material. Each round, players thoughtfully place their tiles so that their bin walls connect with only one kind of recyclable material inside. At the end of the game, bins can be any shape or size, but players will not earn points for bins that contain mixed recyclables. Players count up all their validly placed tiles and the player with the most points wins.

Name: Rosetta: The Lost Language – Stars and Street Promo Pack
Description: This Print & Play promo pack contains 2 new locations and 10 new inscriptions for Rosetta: The Lost Language.

Name: Der Fluch des Waldes III (fan expansion for The Adventures of Robin Hood)
Description:
With this adventure booklet you can experience another exciting adventure of Robin Hood and his companions. It plays around the same time as chapter 4. The story of the adventure plays independently of the others and therefore no prior knowledge of other chapters is necessary.

Since new elements and tiles from later adventures have been added, it is recommended that you have already played the basic game. All outlaws already have their own special abilities. The functions for new items can be found on the following page. No prior knowledge of this adventure is required.

There was a great uproar in the camp as the village was overrun by the sheriff's guards raided, the forge burned and Father Egbert had been taken prisoner. Robin, John and Will talked about what to do next. But Marian was still deep in thought and firmly convinced of the name to have heard Alatar before. This man had created the curse and this calamity brought about them. Then she saw the smith's wife sitting on the forest floor, crying.
But there were far more important things to think about than the past. Marian was blown away torn. What should she do?
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Robin Hood

Name: Siehst du aus wie dein Hund?
Description:
In this fun memo game dog and master or mistress must find each other. 50 cards feature funny photos of dogs and their owners with humorous text in an enclosed booklet that includes descriptions of the 25 dog owners and their furry friends.

Why do people look like their dogs in the first place? Is it shared personality traits, barely suppressed narcissistic tendencies, or do they grow together over time like old married couples? This game explores the intense bonds we develop with our dogs.

Name: スリーウォンバッツ (Three Wombats)
Description:
ã‚¹ãƒªãƒ¼ã‚¦ã‚©ãƒ³ãƒãƒƒãƒ„ (Three Wombats) is a card game from Japan for three players only.

Players are wombats, trying to eat well. Each player has three cards showing their wombats hands reaching out. A deck of food cards is shuffle dup, and one dealt face-up. Players choose their wombat card to play simultaneously.

The result is worked out similar to rock-paper-scissors. Depending on the different combinations, players will get more or less food.

The player's goal is to eat the right amount over five rounds to win. Getting too much food or little makes the wombat ill.
user summary

Name: Qui veut gagner des neurones?
Description:
Who wants to train his neurons? In this trivia game of 450 cards, you can explore 5 themes (sciences, general culture, puzzles, vocabulary and intelligence quotient), and 3 difficulty levels.

The first player take a card, read the theme and the question and select one or several players to answer it. If a challenged player has the correct answer, he wins the points written on the card and take a card to challenge the others. If nobody can answer, the player who asked the question wins the points of the card, multiply by the number of challenged players. The person who reach first a certain amount of points (previously defined)is declared the winner.

Name: Apéro 90's
Description:
How much do you remember about Ricky Martin, Pablo Escobar or the Addams Family ? It's time to check that with this card based Trivia about the 90s.

140 cards for 3 themes (Movies and medias, society, music), earning 1 to 3 points, according to difficulty. 
The person with the most points once all rounds have finished is declared the winner.

Name: FAQ: Frequently Asked Questions
Description: You’ve been given all the answers, but can you come up with the funniest question? A hilarious party game that gives you the answers where players come up with questions. You must come up with the funniest, most awkward, or downright insulting questions to win the game! For every round one player becomes a judge and reads out an answer from a card. The other players have to come up with the funniest question to the answer within the time allowed.

Name: Eagle Leader
Description:
Eagle Leader is a solitaire air tactical game which depicts NATO's air war in a series of hypothetical Cold War Gone Hot scenarios. The game covers the late Cold War, from 1976 (the introduction year of the Eagle) to 1991, with featured aircraft including the F-15C Eagle, the F-15E Strike Eagle, the F-111 Aardvark, the EF-111 Raven, and the F-16 Viper.

Eagle Leader focuses on force packaging-- the selection of the right aircraft and the right munitions will make the difference between success and failure for your squadron. You will be asked to make decisions that NATO Air Planners would've had to consider in the real world.

This game adds new aspects to the Leader series such as electronic warfare aircraft, US and NATO-specific skills, and an expanded "Squadron Operations" module for Leader players looking for the most detailed experience.

The core game contains 312 cards and 672 counters, including:


     198 x Aircraft cards
         F-15C Eagle
         F-15E Strike Eagle
         F-15J Eagle (Japan)
         F-16C Fighting Falcon
         F-16 ADF
         CF-18 Hornet (Canada)
         EF-111 Raven
         F-111C Aardvark (Australia)
         F-111F Aardvark
         F-4F Wild Weasel
         A-4K Kahu (New Zealand)
         A-7D Corsair II
         Tornado GR.1A (United Kingdom)
    
     11 x Squadron Asset cards
         RF-4 Flash Phantom
         A-10 Thunderbolt II
         F-117 Nighthawk
         E-3 Sentry
         KC-10 Extender
         KC-135 Stratotanker
    
     6 x Support cards
         Airborne Battalion
         Army Attack Helicopters
         M270 MLRS
         PJ Teams
         SOF Team
         Tomahawk Strike
    
     50 x Target cards
     37 x Event cards
     10 x Special Condition cards


In addition, the core box includes:


     8 x Campaign sheets
     3 x Player Help sheets
     1 x Airbase Squadron Control sheet
     1 x Player Log sheet
     1 x Tactical Display board
     1 x Rulebook


—description from the publisher

Name: Dual Gauge: Denmark and England & Wales Maps
Description:
The long-awaited second map pack for Dual Gauge. Both maps incentivize tokening cities. When the game end is triggered for the subtle Denmark map, a company's final stock value might drop depending on how many stations have been placed - the fewer stations, the steeper the drop! Tokening on the England & Wales map will increase a city's payout. Getting big dividends is the name of the game - helped along by the passenger trains that score dits without counting them against your route, and hindered by the dangerous momentum of railway mania that might rust your trains (including 4Ts and 5Ts!) right out from under you. 3-5 Players (Denmark), 3-4 Players (England & Wales).

-description from publisher's website

Name: Two Lies & a Truth
Description:
Can you tell truth from lies?
In this twisted take on the original game, you’ll have to find the truth...rather than the lie. It’s harder than you think. And that’s a fact. Or an alternative fact. Or both.

From history to humor, politics to performers. No lies too big. No truths too real. It's the perfect game for the post-fact world.

On a player turn, the pick a card and read it out loud. Other players guess which one of the three statements is true. If correct, they earn points otherwise lost points. Most points at a predetermine end wins.

200ish lies, 100ish truths

-description from publisher's website

Name: Sparrow: A Game of Triumphs
Description:
Sparrow: A Game of Triumphs is a trick taking game using four plain suits (black, green, red, and yellow) along with an extra suit of 22 triumphs or trump cards. The Sparrow is the lowest ranking triumph.

Each player receives a hand of 12 cards with an additional six cards being dealt to the kitty. Players bid to become the declarer by stating how few cards they wish to exchange with the kitty.

Sparrow is a point trick game. Each card is worth a point value indicated by the number of stars. Instead of trying to win the greater number of tricks, the declarer's side tries to win the majority of card points taken in tricks.

Name: Just Heroes
Description:
As a hero defending the city, the player tries to fight off the attacking villains. Just Heroes is a must-follow trick-taking game, and the hero with the highest number in his suit is the one who performs the best attack.

The hero using the highest number of attributes (suits) is the most successful. If the total number of cards played is much higher than the villain’s resistance, the damage to the city will occur and the hero’s fame is reduced. If the total number of cards played is less than the villain’s resistance, all the heroes’ fame is reduced. The heroes, together, need to attack the villain “just right”.

In addition, heroes have an “attack limit.” No matter how powerful a hero is, they can’t keep fighting at full strength. If a hero keeps winning through trickery, they will become exhausted and collapse.

The winner of the game is the hero who “moderately” wins the battle against the villain and protects the city.

Name: Regatul lui Enroh
Description:
An epic board game. The heroes of the Romanian fairy tales meet in the Kingdom of Enroh, a magical place that hides the most coveted gem: "Youth without old age". Be the strategist of the team made up of 12 fantastic 3D characters from the Land of Fairy Tales: Leprechauns, Braves, Beard-Elbows, Fate, Emperor Green, Giant, Fairy Fairy, Handsome Boy, Ileana Cosânzeana, Solomonar, Wanton Horse, Master Bird or you can choose the 12 fantastic creatures from the Other Land: Undead, Pricolici, Water nymph, Witch, Moloch, Kite, Shrew, Mother of the Forest, Dragon, Corcoaia, The Squirrel or Werewolf.

On a map with 135 squares, the players should conquer from a total of 4 castels (1 Victory point each), 4 dangeros areas (1 Victory point each) and 1 center where is located "Youth without old age" (3 victory points), at least 9 victory points. Other methods are to conquer all Castles + center, or all dangerous areas + center. The last posibility is to have with 8 prisoniers more than the opponent.

Each hero have a certain value and movement on the map. The players can buy and use the heroes on the map to collect gold, special cards and conquer the objectives. The players can move the heroes based on the road indicated by the dices. Each dice have a corespondance with a road.
There are 27 special cards with different options, and allows to block a road or a hero, win gold, rob a castle, organize ambush, cure, spy and others.

Enroh's Kingdom is a 100% Romanian board game, made in Romania and contains:

1 map
2 individual boards for the players
36 cards with heroes
88 special cards
16 conquest cards
50 gold cards
2 dices
game instructions

We invite you to a fascinating world of heroes from Romanian fairy tales, with places, expressions, customs and traditions from our mythology, where each person has a story, where luck usually takes you otherwise. , and the inspiration and the strategy guide you to a magic crystal, which hides the secret of Romanian stories: "Youth without old age"!

Name: A.E.G.I.S Wildmoves: Roll n' Fight
Description:
The characters of AEGIS face off in head-to-head melee battles of bluffing and prediction! Both players are armed with the same set of cards, but roll dice to determine their power and which of their Wild Move special attacks they have access to. The fight moves back and forth on the battlefield as blows are landed, granting advantage to those in the right position!

Features:
    Fast, strategic battles in 10 minutes and no setup!
    Options for 2 and 4-player battles!
    10 unique characters from all corners of Sigaea!
    4 unique stages, each with their own opportunities and hazards!
    10 beautiful AEGIS d6 dice!

—description from the publisher

Name: SPYBAM
Description:
In SPYBAM, the different players (CEOs) compete with each other to gain control of the world. You can buy properties or campaigns on each continent and negotiate mergers between players, but ... beware of spies!! Their goals are dark, and they will try to screw you up.
The setup begins by randomly delivering a business card and a different famous character card to each player with their own missions in order to win in SPYBAM. Even so, there are players who will have to go on a different side: the spies. They go together and win together. There will be a spy leader who knows the rest of the spies and the latter do not know the rest of their guild, so the spy leader must try to organize them without being discovered.
At the beginning of each round, an extraordinary event card will be raised that benefits or affects depending on how you have your properties located on the different continents. Be prepared as these events can change your plans.
Then each player's turn begins. Each one has 3 steps to perform:
1) Steal an Advantage or Disadvantage card depending on the die.
2) Draw a Property, Campaign or Fusion / Absorption card, choosing whether to activate it (paying its price) or save it in your deck of cards.
3) Negotiate one of the following 5 options: activate a card from your deck, auction a card from your deck, forcibly buy an active property (from another player) paying double its price, move your headquarters or buy an advantage card to the bank.
At the end of the turn of all the players, each one must invest in security the amount he considers, putting the money he considers in the security envelope. After this, all the players close their eyes and it is the spies' turn: one by one they will attack whoever they consider, leaving a token in front of the player. At the end of this dynamic, each player will look at the number of spy tokens received. If the number of millions invested is less than or equal to the spy tokens received, he will lose an active property. After this, each player receives the income from his properties and other cards before starting the next event or round.
The objective of each player is to complete the missions assigned to their character as soon as possible. But if you are a spy, your goal is to fulfil the common spy missions, leaving aside those of your character. Spies win as a group.
At any time during the game, a player can accuse another of being a spy, if he succeeds, he eliminates the spy from the game, but if he fails, he must compensate that player with a payment of money. Although if the accusation is carried out with an "absorption" card in its possession, if the accusation is correct, it takes all the spy's (Active) cards to its inventory (Not activated) in addition to eliminating it, and if it fails there is no penalty.

—description from the designer

En SPYBAM, los distintos jugadores (CEOs) compiten entre ellos por alzarse con el control del mundo. Podrás comprar propiedades o campañas en cada continente y negociar fusiones entre jugadores, pero… ¡¡cuidado con los espías!! Sus objetivos son oscuros y trataran de fastidiarte.
El setup comienza entregando aleatoriamente una carta negocio y una carta personaje famoso distinto a cada jugador con unas misiones propias para poder ganar en SPYBAM. Aun así, hay jugadores que les tocará ir en un bando diferente: los espías. Ellos van juntos y ganan juntos. Habrá un espía líder que conoce al resto de espías y estos últimos no conocen al resto de su gremio, por lo que el espía líder debe tratar de organizarlos sin que le descubran. 
Al comienzo de cada ronda se levantará una carta de evento extraordinario que beneficia o afecta según tengas situadas tus propiedades por los diferentes continentes. Prepárate puesto que estos eventos pueden modificar tus planes. 
Después comienza el turno de cada jugador. Cada uno tiene 3 pasos a realizar:
1) Robar una tarjeta Ventaja o Desventaja según el dado. 
2) Robar una carta de Propiedad, Campaña o Fusión/Absorción, eligiendo si activarla (pagando su precio) o guardarla en tu mazo de cartas.
3) Negociar una de las siguientes 5 opciones: activar una carta de tu mazo, subastar una carta de tu mazo, comprar forzosamente una propiedad activa (de otro jugador) pagando el doble de su precio, mover tu sede o comprar una ventaja a la banca.
Al finalizar el turno de todos los jugadores, cada uno deberá invertir en seguridad la cantidad que estime, metiendo el dinero que considere en el sobre de seguridad. Tras esto todos los jugadores cierran los ojos y es el turno de los espías: uno a uno irán atacando a quien consideren dejando una ficha delante del jugador. Al final de esta dinámica cada jugador mirara el número de fichas espías recibidas. Si el número de millones invertidos es menor o igual a las fichas espías recibidas, perderá una propiedad activa. Tras esto, cada jugador recibe los ingresos de sus propiedades y otras cartas antes de comenzar el siguiente evento o ronda.
El objetivo de cada jugador es cumplir las misiones que tiene asignado su personaje lo antes posible. Pero si te ha tocado ser espía, tu objetivo es cumplir las misiones de espías en común, dejando de lado las de tu personaje. Los espías ganan en grupo.
En cualquier momento de la partida un jugador puede acusar a otro de ser espía, si acierta elimina al espía de la partida, pero si falla deberá indemnizar a ese jugador con un pago de dinero. Aunque si la acusación la realiza teniendo en su poder una carta de “absorción” si acierta la acusación, se lleva todas las cartas (Activas) del espía a su inventario (Sin activar) además de eliminarle, y si falla no hay penalización.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

Name: Rampage at the Rockport Tower
Description:
A giant gorilla has been terrorizing the city of Rockport since Monday. All attempts to subdue the monster has failed. Named "Coco" by the locals, Coco will climb up the Rockport International to evade his attackers. As he climbs up the tower, military planes release a torrent of gunfire to attempt to stop Coco's rampage. Using a traditional deck of card, you will assume the role of Coco. Two columns of cards will create your tower. Starting from the bottom of the tower, you will manipulate cards to create an ascending order of cards all the way to the top of the tower. Using memory, planning and a little bit of luck, if you make it to the top of the tower, you win!

But watch out! The higher up you go, the more likely that military planes will successfully hit you. If you are hit three times, before making it to the top of the tower, you lose!

Once you are comfortable with the game, you can increase the difficulty with the Night Rampage variant. This requires a great deal of memorization. There is also an Extended variant with the addition of a two card spire on top of the building. This will challenge you with a thinner draw deck and a more intense plane attack.

Can you safely guide Coco to the top of the tower?

Name: Island of Cards: Solitaire Game
Description:
Island of Cards is a a solitaire card game using a traditional deck of cards. You will try to complete a 7 X 7 grid of cards, filling every spot with a card. At the end of the game, you would lose a point for any card not placed. Gain one point for each card left your draw deck.

Each turn you will draw a card and place beside a card that has a value higher or lower by one. As the deck become thinner and the island grows, you choices will diminish.  Can you complete the Island of Cards?

Name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Bracer Phoenix
Description:
The Shanghai Shield, Bracer Phoenix opens fire! A triple-pilot Jaeger, Bracer Phoenix carries a complement of artillery, including the quad-mounted vortex cannon with a 360° firing arc!

Contents:

1 Bracer Phoenix Jaeger model
1 Bracer Phoenix Conn-Pod
6 x Bracer Phoenix Action Cards
3 x Bracer Phoenix Pilot Cards
1 x Charge Counter
1 x Ammo Counter

Name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Cherno Alpha
Description:
The juggernaut Cherno Alpha joins the battle! This Mark-1 bruiser engages Kaiju threats with thick armor plates and Supercharged Tesla Fists, making short work of careless foes!

Contents:

1 Cherno Alpha Jaeger model
1 Cherno Alpha Conn-Pod
6 x Cherno Alpha Action Cards
3 x Cherno Alpha Pilot Cards
1 x Charge Counter
1 x Ammo Counter

Name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Crimson Typhoon
Description:
The street fighter Crimson Typhoon storms into battle! Piloted by the Wei Tang triplets, Crimson Typhoon uses the ‘Thundercloud Formation’ to attack with her deadly triple saws!

Contents:

1 Crimson Typhoon Jaeger model
1 Crimson Typhoon Conn-Pod
6 x Crimson Typhoon Action Cards
3 x Crimson Typhoon Pilot Cards
1 x Charge Counter
1 x Ammo Counter

Name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Otachi
Description:
The winged monstrosity Otachi soars into the fight! Combining a powerful crushing tail and burning acid spray with the ability to fly, Otachi brings down the pain from above!

Contents:

1 x Otachi Kaiju Model
1 x Otachi Kaiju Signature
6 x Otachi Action Cards
3 x Mutation Cards
1 x Rage Counter
1 x Kaiju Blue Counter

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress – Bakemono Mask Promo Card
Description:
Bakemono Mask - Forbidden Fortress Artifact - Promo 457

Once per turn, when you kill an Enemy model, gain D6 x $10.
You are immune to the Enemy ability Fear.

This was available from the holiday 2021 sale at the Flying Frog webstore for orders over 100$.

Name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Raijin
Description:
The electrifying monster Raijin charges into battle! This Kaiju’s unique supercell brainstem powers reactive plates, allowing Raijin to store energy then take revenge with deadly attacks!

Contents:

1 x Raijin Kaiju Model
1 x Raijin Kaiju Signature
6 x Raijin Action Cards
3 x Mutation Cards
1 x Rage Counter
1 x Kaiju Blue Counter

Name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Slattern
Description:
The cruel behemoth Slattern emerges from the breach! An immense living arsenal, Slattern is equipped with triple armor-piercing tail, used to tear through the metal armor of its Jaeger prey!

Contents:

1 x Slattern Kaiju Model
1 x Slattern Kaiju Signature
6 x Slattern Action Cards
3 x Mutation Cards
1 x Rage Counter
1 x Kaiju Blue Counter

Name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Guardian Bravo
Description:
The defiant defender Guardian Bravo has arrived! Packed with the latest J-Tech upgrades, Guardian Bravo uses the Arc Whip to ensnare oncoming Kaiju and bring them down!

Contents:

1 Guardian Bravo Jaeger model
1 Guardian Bravo Conn-Pod
6 x Guardian Bravo Action Cards
3 x Guardian Bravo Pilot Cards
1 x Charge Counter
1 x Ammo Counter

Name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Leatherback
Description:
The rampaging beast Leatherback leaps into action! Leatherback not only has thick skin and terrifying brute strength, but it can also generate an electromagnetic pulse to disable its foes.

Contents:

1 x Leatherback Kaiju Model
1 x Leatherback Kaiju Signature
6 x Leatherback Action Cards
3 x Mutation Cards
1 x Rage Counter
1 x Kaiju Blue Counter

Name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Gipsy Danger
Description:
The legendary Jaeger Gipsy Danger turns the tide! A shining beacon of courage, this Mark-3 veteran brings to bear pulse cannon, rocket elbow and chain sword against the Kaiju threat.

Contents:
1 Gipsy Danger Jaeger model
1 Gipsy Danger Conn-Pod
6 x Gipsy Danger Action Cards
3 x Jaeger Pilot Cards
3 x Jager Upgrade Cards
1 Charge Counter
1 Ammo Counter

Name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Hakuja
Description:
The living earthquake Hakuja burrows into the fight! Part biological tank, part siege weapon, this Category IV Kaiju moves through the ground to unleash ruinous attacks on unsuspecting targets.

Contents:
1 Hakuja Kaiju model
1 Hakuja Kaiju Signature
6 x Hakuja Action Cards
3 x Hakuja Mutation Cards
1 Rage Counter
1 Kaiju Blue Counter

Name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Obsidian Fury
Description:
The sinister warrior Obsidian Fury is unleashed! Bristling with weapons, this titanic mech is able to overpower and brutally destroy almost any Jaeger in the PPDC fleet. Can anything stop this menace?

Contents:
1 Obsidian Fury Jaeger model
1 Obsidian Fury Conn-Podd
6 x Obsidian Fury Action Cards
3 x Obsidian Fury Mutation Cards
1 Rage Counter
1 Kaiju Blue Counter

Name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Saber Athena
Description:
The hyper-agile Mark-6 Jaeger Saber Athena leaps into action! Equipped with mechrobatic J-Tech upgrades and fusing Twin Plasma Swords, Saber Athena takes the fight to the enemy.

Contents:
1 Saber Athena Jaeger model
1 Saber Athena Conn-Pod
6 x Saber Athena Action Cards
3 x Jaeger Pilot Cards
3 x Jager Upgrade Cards
1 Charge Counter
1 Ammo Counter

Name: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
Description:
Get into a spin with this board game adaptation of the hit BBC One show that has reinvented The Wheel!

This time, you’re the contestant in a race to complete your own set of seven questions and make it through to the End Game, where one final question stands in the way of victory.

Choose any seven categories from the set of 14 different subjects and place these cards around the edge of The Wheel.

There are 532 category questions and 39 End Game questions included in the game.

The centrepiece of the game is a large 20cm mechanical spinning wheel with unique push down mechanism.

Spin the contestant spinner board to select which player or team is in play.

Choose a category then press the push button to “Spin the Wheel!”

If The Wheel arrow lands on the gold space, the player or team is asked an easy gold question; if it lands on blue then a trickier blue question awaits... but watch out for the red as you’ll be Shutdown and thrown off The Wheel!

The first player or team to complete their Wheel by clearing all seven categories around The Wheel goes through to the End Game, where they face one final question to win the game.

Name: Oh Crud
Description:
Oh Crud is the fun and exciting new card game that's like 6 games in 1. There are 6 rounds of game play and each round is played slightly different.

Before each round, you roll the appropriate dice which can drastically affect your game play strategy. It's different every time you play!

The object of the game is to avoid getting any CRUD and get the lowest score. When you get CRUD, you get points and you don't want any points because the person with the lowest score at the end of the game wins! Strategize which card you're going to play next so you don't get stuck with the CRUD!

-description from publisher's website

Name: Power Switch
Description:
Power Switch is the ultimate game of strategy! Who has the Power in your group? You will find out quickly as you test all your game playing skills by building Power Towers and supporting Power Lines. Each round, one player shouts: “I’ve got the Power”!

There are 36 different ways to start the game. Never the same game twice! Roll the dice to determine the Power Card each round. Use the Shock Play Card on other players when they least expect it to stun them for added fun! Power Switch cards instantly change the energy between players. The winner is declared the Power Player by all until the next game.

Using a mechnism that combines Sequence with Uno, players compete to finish their card line while avoiding penalties from their opponents.  the first player to discard all their cards, wins!

Name: Ricochet
Description:
Ricochet is a solitaire card game that combines Tri-Peaks Solitaire with the arcade classic Breakout.

In this game, players use the top card of the waste pile to destroy cards along the four surrounding walls.  Each wall has three layers, and as layers are destroyed, more cards are uncovered.

Play your cards right, completely destroy the walls, and win the game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Innomination
Description:
Innomination, the customizable card game. Set in a world of Science Fantasy, select a Nation of various humans, lizardman, or giant insects, pick a leader, make a deck, and battle with another player. This is a one-versus-one game where you win by defeating your opponent. The language on cards does allow play with more than two players (but the game isn't competitively balanced around this).

Innomination is a customizeable card game with deckbuilding elements. It similar play structure to games like Magic: The Gathering with elements from Yu-Gi-Oh!, Force of Will TCG, and the Pokemon TCG. Digital card games like Hearthstone and Shadowverse were also in mind. If you've played any of these, Innomination may feel familiar to you.  Innomination is not a trading card game (TCG). It is to be sold as a complete game right out of a box, like a board game. You'll get a full playset of every card. No rarities, no booster packs, no time spend scouring the secondary market for singles... Open the box knowing you have a complete card game.

Every turn, you will set a Source card into play. Source cards produce Aether, the main resource used to play cards in your hand. The better the card is, the more Aether it costs. Unlike most games, the Source cards are in their own deck, and you get to choose which card you put into play every turn. There are six nations, each one with their own people, culture, and each specializing in an archetype, like aggro (win early with cheap, efficient cards), midrange (playing progressively stronger cards), and control (hold on until the late game and win with powerful, expensive cards).

The Named Deck is the main mechanic of Innomination. Use the Named Deck to name (evolving) your nameless cards in the Main Deck into upgraded versions. You can only do this as a player action once per turn, but there are many Nations that have ways to do this multiple times.

Name: Knowtable
Description:
Knowtable is a unique card game that is 100 percent about connection between its players.  Players get to share their stories and show off what they have noticed about the other players in the game.  Players learn about one another and learn what other people have noticed about them.  It is the rare kind of game where no one is sad when they “lose” because the process of the game is so fun and affirming.

I developed Knowtable over many years with my daughters.  I am a single mother who values my connection with my daughters above all else.  We invented this game and we played it often because it always made us laugh and feel closer to one another.

It is best for 3-8 players ages 10 and up, although it can be modified for younger players.  The premise is that a “category card” is pulled by a judge and the players have ten seconds to think of something that falls within that category that will *most appeal* to the judge.  At 10 seconds the judge counts down, “3-2-1” and the guessers shout out their guess. For example, the category is “car.”  The guessers might respond: “a mercedes,” “the 1976 Rabbit that you got on your 16th birthday,” “a bike because cars are bad for the planet.” Anything goes so long as it will appeal to the judge.

This alone sponsors conversation.  Players like to explain their answer and the judge likes to explain why he or she picks the answer that most appeals to him or her.  The winning guesser gets the point and becomes the next judge.  In the case of a tie where more than one player asserts the same “winning” guess, “break cards” are pulled. The break cards contain descriptions such as “biggest hands,” “youngest,” “shortest”, “most recently ate a piece of fruit,” etc.  The player that best fits the description wins the tie break, gets a point and becomes the next judge.

—description from the designer

Name: Xmas Socks
Description:
Who will be the first to find the Xmas sock on the dice?
Shuffle the cards with the colourful Xmas socks thoroughly and spread them out on the table with the sock-side facing upwards so that everyone can see them clearly.
Each player will then take turns to throw all three dice, which will determine the colour, pattern and picture of the sock to be found.
Now you need to be fast! The player who finds the right sock first picks the card up using their suction pad and has won that card. The first player to collect 5 cards wins the game!

Name: Schnattergei
Description:
In Schnattergei, you need to call out the right words at the right time — and know when to hit the deck!

To start, deal each player a deck of 25 face-down cards. Cards show one of seven items on them — banana, strawberry, elephant, cocoa, carrot, bell pepper, or schnattergei (this being a chatty parrot) — with each item being in one of four colors: yellow, red, blue, or brown.

On a turn, flip the top card of your deck onto the discard pile and quickly say the object (banana, strawberry, elephant, cocoa) matching the color of the card revealed (yellow, red, blue, brown). You never say "carrot" or "pepper", and when you flip a schnattergei, you must "parrot" the previous player by saying what they said, not what matches the color of the parrot. If you make a mistake, take two cards from your deck and place them under the discard pile.

When someone reveals an item that matches the item on the top of the discard pile, everyone must race to slap the pile. Whoever does so first claims all the cards in the discard pile and puts them under their draw deck, face down. 
The game ends when a player runs out of cards and does not manage to win the discard pile in the same round. Whoever has the most cards at the end of the game wins.

Name: Boggle First Words
Description:
Kids can practice their spelling and word recognition while playing this Boggle game for little ones. With 2 different levels of difficulty, The Ready Set Discover Boggle First Words game is an exciting entry into the world of words. The Find and Match level is a fun activity that helps kids explore words by matching the colored letter cubes to the colored letters on the card. The Roll and Spell level has kids rolling the letter dice to match a die with each letter on their card trying to complete the word within 3 tries. When each letter has been matched, they say each letter out loud, spelling the image they see on the card.

Includes: 5 letter dice, 30 double-sided word cards, cardboard game mat, and instructions.
Families: Versions & Editions: Junior Versions of Grown-Up Games

Name: Samesies
Description: Time to start using that dirty mind for good... or at least for fun! Introducing Samesies, the party game full of double entendres. The rules are easy: Players takes a Safe" Card and a "Risky" Card, and compete to find the funniest phrase that suits both situations. The perfect game for those who just can't help but build a bridge between normal and naughty.

Name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 23
Description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 23 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:


     Nexus NXS1-B/C
     Star Python
     Fujin RJN-301-F
     Raijin RJN-101-A/B/C/X/301-B
     Lancelot LNC25-09
     Rifleman IIC 1/2/9/10
     Guillotine GLT-7M
     Nova Cat T/E/F/G/H/M
     Grand Crusader GRN-D-01/01-X/02/02-B
     Star Crusader Prime/A/B
     Katana CRK-5006-1


—description from the publisher

Name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 24
Description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 24 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:


     Elemental III Battle Armor
     Skinwalker (Ryoken III) Prime/A/B/C/D/E/F
     Grand Dragon DRG-12K
     Flashman FLS-10E
     Stalker STK-9F
     Alpha Wolf Prime/A/B/C
     Annihilator ANH-5W
     Atlas AS7-K-DC/S3/S3-DC/S4
     Atlas AS8-K/KE/S
     Atlas C/C2/C3
     Atlas II AS7-DK-H


—description from the publisher

Name: BattleTech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 7
Description:
Arm yourself with technical readouts, playable scenarios, an in-depth look at the weaponization of gift giving in the Draconis Combine, a glimpse into Clan Sea Fox’s customer service, an article on the importance of battlefield salvage, and more—all from elite BattleTech authors and recruits who have earned their stripes.

Contains rules for:


     Chaos Campaign Scenario: The Christmas Eve Coup (Total Warfare)
     The Abominable Icemonster (Mechwarrior: Destiny)
     One Last Favor, Old Friend: A MechWarrior: Destiny Mission Briefing
     Combat Shotguns: For Close Encounters (A Time of War)


—description from the publisher

Name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes Against the Red Star – Red Gauntlet
Description:
The Red Army Moves West Expansion for Heroes Against the Red Star

Red Gauntlet is an expansion for Heroes Against the Red Star from the Lock ‘n Load Tactical System. Included are eight brand-new scenarios and a new map. It features fluid, impulse-based turns, squad-level actions, and individual heroics. The scenarios span the entire length of the war, starting with the first American counterattacks in the Gap and desperate efforts to slow down the Soviet juggernaut. We see Soviet Separate Air battalions landing to clear the way for armored spearheads and vicious ambushes against columns of Soviet vehicles.

There are armored formations clashing outside of Frankfurt. We see the French desperately attempting to hold the Soviets at bay in bitter fighting on the streets of Paris and daring rear area raids on supply depots, and the combined NATO last desperate final attempt to stop the Soviet Black Guards Tank Division from reaching Le Havre, and splitting the NATO line from north and south France.

Name: Hunted: North Pole
Description:
Everyone was happily working on toys and getting ready for Christmas when all of a sudden Jack Frost and an army of minions showed up. They kidnapped Santa, scattered the elves, and are trying to ruin Christmas!

Now, you’ll have to work your way through the North Pole and rescue Santa before Christmas is canceled... all while Jack Frost’s minions try to hunt you down...

Overview:
Take on the role of one of Santa’s elves in order to sneak your way through the North Pole, defeat Jack Frost, rescue Santa, and save Christmas. But be wary, Jack's minions are searching for you to put a premature end to your holiday heroics. Collect weapons, recruit other elves, avoid capture, and find Santa before time runs out and Christmas is ruined!

This game takes Gabe Barrett's "HUNTED" cooperative card-game system and adds a holiday flair. There was a VERY limited physical print run of the game made available as a 'secret bonus' only to backers of the "Hunted: Wode Ridge" Kickstarter campaign in early 2021. A print-and-play version is currently available to download.

Name: Infinity Casino
Description:
In this betting game, players are allowed to write any number on their blank dry erase chips. However, if you have the highest number out of all the players, you cannot win the bet; and if you bet the lowest number, you will be fined. If you are in the middle when the number is rolled, you will win your bet.

The winner of the game is the player with the most moeny at the end.
